guiQt.model

guiQt.model module: Model classes for uHDR GUI application.

This module implements the Model component of the Model-View-Controller (MVC) architecture pattern used in uHDR. It contains data models that manage the state and business logic for image gallery, image editing, aesthetics analysis, and various UI components.

The models handle:

  • Image gallery management and pagination
  • HDR image processing pipeline parameters
  • Tone curve and color editing configurations
  • Geometry transformations and lightness masking
  • Aesthetics analysis and color palette extraction
  • Threading coordination for parallel processing

Main Classes: - ImageWidgetModel: Simple image display model - ImageGalleryModel: Gallery view with pagination and process-pipes - AppModel: Main application state and directory management - EditImageModel: Complete HDR editing pipeline model - ToneCurveModel: B-spline tone curve editing with control points - LightnessMaskModel: Tone range selection masking - HDRviewerModel: HDR display configuration - ImageAestheticsModel: Color palette and aesthetics analysis - ColorEditorsAutoModel: Automatic color editor configuration

Threading Models: - AdvanceSliderModel: Slider state management - LchColorSelectorModel: LCH color space editing - GeometryModel: Geometric transformations

  20"""
  21guiQt.model module: Model classes for uHDR GUI application.
  22
  23This module implements the Model component of the Model-View-Controller (MVC) 
  24architecture pattern used in uHDR. It contains data models that manage the 
  25state and business logic for image gallery, image editing, aesthetics analysis,
  26and various UI components.
  27
  28The models handle:
  29- Image gallery management and pagination
  30- HDR image processing pipeline parameters
  31- Tone curve and color editing configurations  
  32- Geometry transformations and lightness masking
  33- Aesthetics analysis and color palette extraction
  34- Threading coordination for parallel processing
  35
  36Main Classes:
  37    - ImageWidgetModel: Simple image display model
  38    - ImageGalleryModel: Gallery view with pagination and process-pipes
  39    - AppModel: Main application state and directory management
  40    - EditImageModel: Complete HDR editing pipeline model
  41    - ToneCurveModel: B-spline tone curve editing with control points
  42    - LightnessMaskModel: Tone range selection masking
  43    - HDRviewerModel: HDR display configuration
  44    - ImageAestheticsModel: Color palette and aesthetics analysis
  45    - ColorEditorsAutoModel: Automatic color editor configuration
  46
  47Threading Models:
  48    - AdvanceSliderModel: Slider state management
  49    - LchColorSelectorModel: LCH color space editing
  50    - GeometryModel: Geometric transformations
  51"""
  52

  54# --- Import ------------------------------------------------------------------
  55# -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  56

  58import pathos.multiprocessing, multiprocessing, functools
  59import numpy as np
  60from geomdl import BSpline
  61from geomdl import utilities
  62
  63from datetime import datetime
  64

  74class ImageWidgetModel(object):
  75    """
  76    Simple model for individual image widget display.
  77    
  78    Manages the data state for a single image widget that can display
  79    either numpy arrays or hdrCore.image.Image objects.
  80    
  81    Attributes:
  82        - controller: Reference to the controlling ImageWidgetController
  83        - image: Image data (numpy.ndarray or hdrCore.image.Image)
  84    """
  85
  86    def __init__(self, controller):
  87        """
  88        Initialize the image widget model.
  89        
  90        Args:
  91            controller: Parent ImageWidgetController instance
  92        """
  93        self.controller = controller
  94        self.image = None # numpy array or hdrCore.image.Image
  95
  96    def setImage(self,image): 
  97        """
  98        Set the image to be displayed.
  99        
 100        Args:
 101            image (numpy.ndarray or hdrCore.image.Image): Image data to display
 102        """
 103        self.image = image
 104
 105    def getColorData(self): 
 106        """
 107        Extract color data from the current image for display.
 108        
 109        Returns:
 110            numpy.ndarray: RGB color data ready for Qt display
 111        """
 112        if isinstance(self.image, np.ndarray):
 113            return self.image
 114        elif isinstance(self.image, hdrCore.image.Image):
 115            return self.image.colorData

 117# --- class ImageGalleryModel --------------------------------------------------------------
 118# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 119class ImageGalleryModel:
 120    """
 121    Model for image gallery management with pagination and process-pipes.
 122    
 123    Handles a collection of images with their associated processing pipelines,
 124    supporting paginated display and thumbnail generation. Each image has an
 125    associated ProcessPipe for HDR editing operations.
 126    
 127    Attributes:
 128        - controller (ImageGalleryController): Parent controller reference
 129        - imageFilenames (list[str]): List of image file paths
 130        - processPipes (list[ProcessPipe]): HDR processing pipelines for each image
 131        - _selectedImage (int): Index of currently selected image (-1 if none)
 132        - aestheticsModels (list): Aesthetic analysis models for images
 133    """
 134
 135    def __init__(self, _controller):
 136        """
 137        Initialize the image gallery model.
 138        
 139        Args:
 140            _controller (ImageGalleryController): Parent controller instance
 141        """
 142        if pref.verbose:  print(" [MODEL] >> ImageGalleryModel.__init__()")
 143
 144        self.controller = _controller
 145        self.imageFilenames = []
 146        self.processPipes = []
 147        self._selectedImage= -1
 148
 149        self.aesthetics = []
 150
 151    def setSelectedImage(self,id): 
 152        """
 153        Set the currently selected image by index.
 154        
 155        Args:
 156            id (int): Index of image to select
 157        """
 158        self._selectedImage = id
 159
 160    def selectedImage(self): 
 161        """
 162        Get the index of currently selected image.
 163        
 164        Returns:
 165            int: Selected image index (-1 if none selected)
 166        """
 167        return self._selectedImage
 168
 169    def getSelectedProcessPipe(self):
 170        """
 171        Get the ProcessPipe associated with the selected image.
 172        
 173        Returns:
 174            ProcessPipe or None: Processing pipeline for selected image
 175        """
 176        if pref.verbose: print(" [MODEL] >> ImageGalleryModel.getSelectedProcessPipe(",  ")")
 177
 178        res = None
 179        if self._selectedImage != -1: res= self.processPipes[self._selectedImage]
 180        return res
 181
 182    def setImages(self, filenames):
 183        """
 184        Load a new set of images into the gallery.
 185        
 186        Initializes the gallery with new image filenames, resets all process-pipes
 187        and aesthetics models, then loads the first page.
 188        
 189        Args:
 190            filenames (list[str]): List of image file paths to load
 191        """
 192        if pref.verbose: print(" [MODEL] >> ImageGalleryModel.setImages(",len(list(copy.deepcopy(filenames))), "images)")
 193
 194        self.imageFilenames = list(filenames)
 195        self.imagesMetadata, self.processPipes =  [], [] # reset metadata and processPipes
 196
 197        self.aestheticsModels = [] # reset aesthetics models
 198
 199        nbImagePage = controller.GalleryMode.nbRow(self.controller.view.shapeMode)*controller.GalleryMode.nbCol(self.controller.view.shapeMode)
 200        for f in self.imageFilenames: # load only first page
 201            self.processPipes.append(None)
 202        self.controller.updateImages() # update controller to update view
 203        self.loadPage(0)
 204
 205    def loadPage(self,nb):
 206        """
 207        Load and process images for a specific page.
 208        
 209        Loads images for the specified page number, creating ProcessPipes
 210        for new images and updating existing ones. Uses threading for
 211        efficient parallel loading.
 212        
 213        Args:
 214            nb (int): Page number to load (0-indexed)
 215        """
 216        if pref.verbose:  print(" [MODEL] >> ImageGalleryModel.loadPage(",nb,")")
 217        nbImagePage = controller.GalleryMode.nbRow(self.controller.view.shapeMode)*controller.GalleryMode.nbCol(self.controller.view.shapeMode)
 218        min_,max_ = (nb*nbImagePage), ((nb+1)*nbImagePage)
 219
 220        loadThreads = thread.RequestLoadImage(self)
 221
 222        for i,f in enumerate(self.imageFilenames[min_:max_]): # load only the current page nb
 223            if not isinstance(self.processPipes[min_+i],hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe):
 224                self.controller.parent.statusBar().showMessage("read image: "+f)
 225                self.controller.parent.statusBar().repaint()
 226                loadThreads.requestLoad(min_,i, f)
 227            else:
 228                self.controller.view.updateImage(i, self.processPipes[min_+i], f)
 229
 230    def save(self):
 231        """
 232        Save all ProcessPipe configurations to their associated image metadata.
 233        
 234        Iterates through all ProcessPipes and saves their parameters as metadata
 235        in the corresponding image files for persistence.
 236        """
 237        if pref.verbose:  print(" [MODEL] >> ImageGalleryModel.save()")
 238
 239        for i,p in enumerate(self.processPipes):
 240            if isinstance(p, hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe): 
 241                p.getImage().metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = p.toDict()            
 242                p.getImage().metadata.save()
 243
 244    def getFilenamesOfCurrentPage(self):
 245        """
 246        Get the filenames for images on the current page.
 247        
 248        Returns:
 249            list[str]: Filenames of images currently displayed
 250        """
 251        minIdx, maxIdx = self.controller.pageIdx()
 252        return copy.deepcopy(self.imageFilenames[minIdx:maxIdx])
 253
 254    def getProcessPipeById(self,i):
 255        """
 256        Get ProcessPipe by index.
 257        
 258        Args:
 259            i (int): Index of desired ProcessPipe
 260            
 261        Returns:
 262            ProcessPipe: Processing pipeline at specified index
 263        """
 264        return self.processPipes[i]
 265

 269class AppModel(object):
 270    """
 271    Main application model managing global state.
 272    
 273    Handles the top-level application state including current working directory,
 274    image file lists, and HDR display configuration.
 275    
 276    Attributes:
 277        - controller: Reference to parent AppController
 278        - directory (str): Current working directory path
 279        - imageFilenames (list[str]): List of image files in directory
 280        - displayHDRProcess: HDR display process reference
 281        - displayModel (dict): HDR display configuration with scaling and shape
 282    """
 283
 284    def __init__(self, controller):
 285        """
 286        Initialize the application model.
 287        
 288        Args:
 289            controller: Parent AppController instance
 290        """
 291        # attributes
 292        self.controller = controller
 293        self.directory = pref.getImagePath()
 294        self.imageFilenames = []
 295        self.displayHDRProcess = None
 296        #V5
 297        self.displayModel = {'scaling':12, 'shape':(2160,3840)}
 298
 299    def setDirectory(self,path):
 300        """
 301        Set working directory and scan for supported image files.
 302        
 303        Args:
 304            path (str): Directory path to scan
 305            
 306        Returns:
 307            iterator: Image filenames found in directory
 308        """
 309        # read directory and return image filename list
 310        self.directory =path
 311        pref.setImagePath(path)
 312        self.imageFilenames = map(lambda x: os.path.join(self.directory,x),
 313                                  hdrCore.utils.filterlistdir(self.directory,('.jpg','.JPG','.hdr','.HDR')))
 314
 315        return self.imageFilenames
 316# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 317# --- Class EditImageModel -----------------------------------------------------------------
 318# ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 319class EditImageModel(object):
 320    """
 321    Model for comprehensive HDR image editing pipeline.
 322    
 323    Manages the complete HDR image editing workflow including exposure adjustment,
 324    contrast control, tone curve manipulation, color editing, and geometric 
 325    transformations. Coordinates with threading system for real-time preview.
 326    
 327    The model builds and manages a ProcessPipe containing:
 328    - Exposure adjustment
 329    - Contrast control
 330    - B-spline tone curve editing
 331    - Lightness masking for selective editing
 332    - Saturation adjustment
 333    - Five independent color editors for targeted color correction
 334    - Geometric transformations (rotation, cropping)
 335    
 336    Attributes:
 337        - controller: Reference to EditImageController
 338        - autoPreviewHDR (bool): Enable automatic HDR preview updates
 339        - processpipe (ProcessPipe): Current HDR processing pipeline
 340        - requestCompute (RequestCompute): Threading coordinator for real-time updates
 341    """
 342    def __init__(self,controller):
 343        """
 344        Initialize the HDR image editing model.
 345        
 346        Args:
 347            controller: Parent EditImageController instance
 348        """
 349        self.controller = controller
 350
 351        self.autoPreviewHDR = False
 352
 353        # ref to ImageGalleryModel.processPipes[ImageGalleryModel._selectedImage]
 354        self.processpipe = None 
 355
 356        # create a RequestCompute
 357        self.requestCompute  = thread.RequestCompute(self)
 358
 359    def getProcessPipe(self): 
 360        """
 361        Get the current processing pipeline.
 362        
 363        Returns:
 364            ProcessPipe: Current HDR processing pipeline
 365        """
 366        return self.processpipe
 367
 368    def setProcessPipe(self, processPipe): 
 369        """
 370        Set a new processing pipeline and trigger computation.
 371        
 372        Args:
 373            processPipe (ProcessPipe): New processing pipeline to use
 374            
 375        Returns:
 376            bool: True if pipeline was set successfully, False if system busy
 377        """
 378        if self.requestCompute.readyToRun:
 379            self.processpipe = processPipe
 380            self.requestCompute.setProcessPipe(self.processpipe)
 381            self.processpipe.compute()
 382            if self.controller.previewHDR and self.autoPreviewHDR:
 383                img = self.processpipe.getImage(toneMap = False)
 384                self.controller.controllerHDR.displayIMG(img)
 385            return True
 386        else:
 387            return False
 388
 389    @staticmethod
 390    def buildProcessPipe():
 391        """
 392        Create a default HDR processing pipeline.
 393        
 394        Builds a complete ProcessPipe with all editing stages configured
 395        with default parameters. The pipeline includes exposure, contrast,
 396        tone curve, masking, saturation, color editors, and geometry.
 397        
 398        WARNING: The initial pipe does not have an input image and must be
 399        configured with setImage() before use.
 400        
 401        Returns:
 402            ProcessPipe: Configured processing pipeline with default parameters
 403        """
 404        processPipe = hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe()
 405
 406        # exposure ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 407        defaultParameterEV = {'EV': 0}                                              
 408        idExposureProcessNode = processPipe.append(hdrCore.processing.exposure(), paramDict=None,name="exposure")   
 409        processPipe.setParameters(idExposureProcessNode, defaultParameterEV)                                        
 410
 411        # contrast ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 412        defaultParameterContrast = {'contrast': 0}                                  
 413        idContrastProcessNode = processPipe.append(hdrCore.processing.contrast(), paramDict=None,  name="contrast") 
 414        processPipe.setParameters(idContrastProcessNode, defaultParameterContrast)                                  
 415
 416        #tonecurve ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 417        defaultParameterYcurve = {'start':[0,0], 
 418                                  'shadows': [10,10],
 419                                  'blacks': [30,30], 
 420                                  'mediums': [50,50], 
 421                                  'whites': [70,70], 
 422                                  'highlights': [90,90], 
 423                                  'end': [100,100]}                         
 424        idYcurveProcessNode = processPipe.append(hdrCore.processing.Ycurve(), paramDict=None,name="tonecurve")      
 425        processPipe.setParameters(idYcurveProcessNode, defaultParameterYcurve)   
 426        
 427        # masklightness ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 428        defaultMask = { 'shadows': False, 
 429                       'blacks': False, 
 430                       'mediums': False, 
 431                       'whites': False, 
 432                       'highlights': False}
 433        idLightnessMaskProcessNode = processPipe.append(hdrCore.processing.lightnessMask(), paramDict=None, name="lightnessmask")  
 434        processPipe.setParameters(idLightnessMaskProcessNode, defaultMask)  
 435
 436        # saturation ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 437        defaultValue = {'saturation': 0.0,  'method': 'gamma'}
 438        idSaturationProcessNode = processPipe.append(hdrCore.processing.saturation(), paramDict=None, name="saturation")    
 439        processPipe.setParameters(idSaturationProcessNode, defaultValue)                     
 440
 441        # colorEditor0 ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 442        defaultParameterColorEditor0= {'selection': {'lightness': (0,100),'chroma': (0,100),'hue':(0,360)},  
 443                                       'edit': {'hue': 0.0, 'exposure':0.0, 'contrast':0.0,'saturation':0.0}, 
 444                                       'mask': False}        
 445        idColorEditor0ProcessNode = processPipe.append(hdrCore.processing.colorEditor(), paramDict=None, name="colorEditor0")  
 446        processPipe.setParameters(idColorEditor0ProcessNode, defaultParameterColorEditor0)
 447
 448        # colorEditor1 ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 449        defaultParameterColorEditor1= {'selection': {'lightness': (0,100),'chroma': (0,100),'hue':(0,360)},  
 450                                       'edit': {'hue': 0.0, 'exposure':0.0, 'contrast':0.0,'saturation':0.0}, 
 451                                       'mask': False}        
 452        idColorEditor1ProcessNode = processPipe.append(hdrCore.processing.colorEditor(), paramDict=None, name="colorEditor1")  
 453        processPipe.setParameters(idColorEditor1ProcessNode, defaultParameterColorEditor1)
 454        
 455        # colorEditor2 ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 456        defaultParameterColorEditor2= {'selection': {'lightness': (0,100),'chroma': (0,100),'hue':(0,360)},  
 457                                       'edit': {'hue': 0.0, 'exposure':0.0, 'contrast':0.0,'saturation':0.0}, 
 458                                       'mask': False}        
 459        idColorEditor2ProcessNode = processPipe.append(hdrCore.processing.colorEditor(), paramDict=None, name="colorEditor2")  
 460        processPipe.setParameters(idColorEditor2ProcessNode, defaultParameterColorEditor2)
 461        
 462        # colorEditor3 ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 463        defaultParameterColorEditor3= {'selection': {'lightness': (0,100),'chroma': (0,100),'hue':(0,360)},  
 464                                       'edit': {'hue': 0.0, 'exposure':0.0, 'contrast':0.0,'saturation':0.0}, 
 465                                       'mask': False}        
 466        idColorEditor3ProcessNode = processPipe.append(hdrCore.processing.colorEditor(), paramDict=None, name="colorEditor3")  
 467        processPipe.setParameters(idColorEditor3ProcessNode, defaultParameterColorEditor3)
 468        
 469        # colorEditor4 ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 470        defaultParameterColorEditor4= {'selection': {'lightness': (0,100),'chroma': (0,100),'hue':(0,360)},  
 471                                       'edit': {'hue': 0.0, 'exposure':0.0, 'contrast':0.0,'saturation':0.0}, 
 472                                       'mask': False}        
 473        idColorEditor4ProcessNode = processPipe.append(hdrCore.processing.colorEditor(), paramDict=None, name="colorEditor4")  
 474        processPipe.setParameters(idColorEditor4ProcessNode, defaultParameterColorEditor4)
 475
 476        # geometry ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 477        defaultValue = { 'ratio': (16,9), 'up': 0,'rotation': 0.0}
 478        idGeometryNode = processPipe.append(hdrCore.processing.geometry(), paramDict=None, name="geometry")    
 479        processPipe.setParameters(idGeometryNode, defaultValue)
 480        # ------------ --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 481
 482        return processPipe
 483
 484    def autoExposure(self):
 485        """
 486        Automatically calculate and apply optimal exposure settings.
 487        
 488        Uses the exposure process's automatic calculation method to determine
 489        optimal exposure value based on image content and applies it to the pipeline.
 490        
 491        Returns:
 492            numpy.ndarray: Processed image with auto-exposure applied
 493        """
 494        if pref.verbose:  print(" [MODEL] >> EditImageModel.autoExposure(",")")
 495
 496        id = self.processpipe.getProcessNodeByName("exposure")
 497        exposureProcess = self.processpipe.processNodes[id].process
 498        img= self.processpipe.getInputImage()
 499        EV = exposureProcess.auto(img)
 500        self.processpipe.setParameters(id,EV)
 501
 502        self.processpipe.compute()
 503
 504        if self.controller.previewHDR and self.autoPreviewHDR:
 505            img = self.processpipe.getImage(toneMap = False)
 506            self.controller.controllerHDR.displayIMG(img)
 507
 508        return self.processpipe.getImage()
 509
 510    def changeExposure(self,value):
 511        """
 512        Manually adjust exposure value.
 513        
 514        Args:
 515            value (float): Exposure adjustment in EV stops
 516        """
 517        if pref.verbose:  print(" [MODEL] >> EditImageModel.changeExposure(",value,")")
 518
 519        id = self.processpipe.getProcessNodeByName("exposure")
 520        self.requestCompute.requestCompute(id,{'EV': value})
 521
 522    def getEV(self):
 523        """
 524        Get current exposure value settings.
 525        
 526        Returns:
 527            dict: Current exposure parameters
 528        """
 529        if pref.verbose:  print(" [MODEL] >> EditImageModel.getEV(",")")
 530        id = self.processpipe.getProcessNodeByName("exposure")
 531        return self.processpipe.getParameters(id)
 532
 533    def changeContrast(self,value):
 534        """
 535        Adjust contrast parameters.
 536        
 537        Args:
 538            value (float): Contrast adjustment value
 539        """
 540        if pref.verbose:  print(" [MODEL] >> EditImageModel.changeContrast(",value,")")
 541
 542        id = self.processpipe.getProcessNodeByName("contrast")
 543        self.requestCompute.requestCompute(id,{'contrast': value})
 544
 545    def changeToneCurve(self,controlPoints):
 546        """
 547        Update tone curve control points.
 548        
 549        Args:
 550            controlPoints (dict): B-spline control point dictionary
 551        """
 552        if pref.verbose: print(" [MODEL] >> EditImageModel.changeToneCurve(",")")
 553
 554        id = self.processpipe.getProcessNodeByName("tonecurve")
 555        self.requestCompute.requestCompute(id,controlPoints)
 556
 557    def changeLightnessMask(self, maskValues):
 558        """
 559        Modify lightness masking parameters.
 560        
 561        Args:
 562            maskValues (dict): Mask configuration for different tone ranges
 563        """
 564        if pref.verbose: print(" [MODEL] >> EditImageModel.changeLightnessMask(",maskValues,")")
 565
 566        id = self.processpipe.getProcessNodeByName("lightnessmask")
 567        self.requestCompute.requestCompute(id,maskValues)
 568
 569    def changeSaturation(self,value):
 570        """
 571        Adjust global saturation.
 572        
 573        Args:
 574            value (float): Saturation adjustment value
 575        """
 576        if pref.verbose:  print(" [MODEL] >> EditImageModel.changeSaturation(",value,")")
 577
 578        id = self.processpipe.getProcessNodeByName("saturation")
 579        self.requestCompute.requestCompute(id,{'saturation': value, 'method': 'gamma'})
 580
 581    def changeColorEditor(self, values, idName):
 582        """
 583        Update color editor parameters.
 584        
 585        Args:
 586            values (dict): Color editor configuration
 587            idName (str): Name of color editor process node
 588        """
 589        if pref.verbose:  print(" [MODEL] >> EditImageModel.changeColorEditor(",values,")")
 590
 591        id = self.processpipe.getProcessNodeByName(idName)
 592        self.requestCompute.requestCompute(id,values)
 593
 594    def changeGeometry(self, values):

 600        """

 603        id = self.processpipe.getProcessNodeByName("geometry")

 608        Update view with newly processed image.

 657class ToneCurveModel():
 658    """
 659    Model for B-spline tone curve editing with multiple control points.
 660    
 661    Manages a tone curve represented as a B-spline with seven control points:
 662    start, shadows, blacks, mediums, whites, highlights, and end. Provides
 663    automatic scaling and constraint validation to maintain curve monotonicity.
 664    
 665    The tone curve operates on a coordinate system where:
 666    - X-axis: Input luminance (0-100)
 667    - Y-axis: Output luminance (0-100) 
 668    - Control points define the curve shape
 669    
 670    Grid representation:
 671        +-------+-------+-------+-------+-------+                             [o]
 672        |       |       |       |       |       |                              ^
 673        |       |       |       |       |   o   |                              |
 674        |       |       |       |       |       |                              |
 675        +-------+-------+-------+-------+-------+                              |
 676        |       |       |       |       |       |                              |
 677        |       |       |       |   o   |       |                              |
 678        |       |       |       |       |       |                              |
 679        +-------+-------+-------+-------+-------+                              |
 680        |       |       |       |       |       |                              |
 681        |       |       |   o   |       |       |                              |
 682        |       |       |       |       |       |                              |
 683        +-------+-------+-------+-------+-------+                              |
 684        |       |       |       |       |       |                              |
 685        |       |   o   |       |       |       |                              |
 686        |       |       |       |       |       |                              |
 687        +-------+-------+-------+-------+-------+                              |
 688        |       |       |       |       |       |                              |
 689        |   o   |       |       |       |       |                              |
 690        |       |       |       |       |       |                              |
 691       [o]-------+-------+-------+-------+-------+-----------------------------+ 
 692  zeros ^ shadows  black   medium  white  highlights                          200
 693
 694    Attributes:
 695        - control (dict): Current control point positions
 696        - default (dict): Default control point positions for reset
 697        - curve (BSpline.Curve): B-spline curve object
 698        - points (numpy.ndarray): Evaluated curve points
 699    """
 700    def __init__(self):
 701        """
 702        Initialize tone curve model with default control points.
 703        """
 704        if pref.verbose: print(" [MODEL] >> ToneCourveModel.__init__()")
 705
 706        #  start
 707        self.control = {'start':[0.0,0.0], 'shadows': [10.0,10.0], 'blacks': [30.0,30.0], 'mediums': [50.0,50.0], 'whites': [70.0,70.0], 'highlights': [90.0,90.0], 'end': [100.0,100.0]}
 708        self.default = {'start':[0.0,0.0], 'shadows': [10.0,10.0], 'blacks': [30.0,30.0], 'mediums': [50.0,50.0], 'whites': [70.0,70.0], 'highlights': [90.0,90.0], 'end': [100.0,100.0]}
 709
 710        self.curve =    BSpline.Curve()
 711        self.curve.degree = 2
 712        self.points =None
 713
 714    def evaluate(self):
 715        """
 716        Evaluate B-spline curve from current control points.
 717        
 718        Constructs a degree-2 B-spline curve using the current control points,
 719        generates appropriate knot vector, and evaluates the curve.
 720        
 721        Returns:
 722            numpy.ndarray: Array of (x,y) points representing the evaluated curve
 723        """
 724        if pref.verbose: print(" [MODEL] >> ToneCurveModel.evaluate(",")")
 725
 726        #self.curve.ctrlpts = copy.deepcopy([self.control['start'],self.control['shadows'],self.control['blacks'],self.control['mediums'], self.control['whites'], self.control['highlights'], self.control['end']])
 727        self.curve.ctrlpts = copy.deepcopy([self.control['start'],self.control['shadows'],self.control['blacks'],self.control['mediums'], self.control['whites'], self.control['highlights'], [200, self.control['end'][1]]])
 728        # auto-generate knot vector
 729        self.curve.knotvector = utilities.generate_knot_vector(self.curve.degree, len(self.curve.ctrlpts))
 730        # evaluate curve and get points
 731        self.points = np.asarray(self.curve.evalpts)
 732
 733        return self.points
 734
 735    def setValue(self, key, value, autoScale=False):
 736        """
 737        Update a control point value with constraints and optional auto-scaling.
 738        
 739        Updates the specified control point while maintaining curve monotonicity.
 740        Optionally performs auto-scaling of adjacent points to maintain smooth
 741        transitions when constraints would be violated.
 742        
 743        Args:
 744            key (str): Control point name ('shadows', 'blacks', etc.)
 745            value (int): New Y-coordinate value for the control point
 746            autoScale (bool): Enable automatic scaling of adjacent points
 747            
 748        Returns:
 749            dict: Updated control points dictionary
 750        """
 751        if pref.verbose: print(" [MODEL] >> ToneCurveModel.setValue(",key,", ",value,", autoScale=",autoScale,")")
 752        value = int(value)
 753        # check key
 754        if key in self.control.keys():
 755            # transform in list
 756            listKeys = list(self.control.keys())
 757            listValues = np.asarray(list(self.control.values()))
 758            index = listKeys.index(key)
 759
 760            if (listValues[:index,1] <= value).all() and (value <= listValues[index+1:,1]).all():
 761                # can change
 762                oldValue = self.control[listKeys[index]]
 763                self.control[listKeys[index]] = [oldValue[0],value]            
 764            elif not (value <= listValues[index+1:,1]).all():
 765                if autoScale:
 766                    minValue = min(listValues[index:,1])
 767                    maxValue = listValues[-1:,1]
 768                    u = (listValues[index+1:,1] -minValue)/(maxValue-minValue)
 769
 770                    newValues = value*(1- u)+ u*maxValue
 771                    for i,v in enumerate(newValues):
 772                        oldValue = self.control[listKeys[i+index+1]]
 773                        self.control[listKeys[i+index+1]] = [oldValue[0],np.round(v)]
 774                else:
 775                    # not autoScale, set to minValue
 776                    oldValue = self.control[listKeys[index]]
 777                    minValue = min(listValues[index+1:,1])
 778                    self.control[listKeys[index]] = [oldValue[0],minValue]
 779            elif not (listValues[:index,1] <= value).all():
 780                if autoScale:
 781                    minValue = listValues[0,1]
 782                    maxValue = max(listValues[:index,1])
 783                    u = (listValues[:index,1] -minValue)/(maxValue-minValue)
 784                    newValues = minValue*(1- u)+ u*value
 785                    for i,v in enumerate(newValues):
 786                        oldValue = self.control[listKeys[i]]
 787                        self.control[listKeys[i]] = [oldValue[0],np.round(v)]
 788                else:
 789                    # not autoScale, set to maxValue
 790                    oldValue = self.control[listKeys[index]]
 791                    maxValue =  max(listValues[:index,1])
 792                    self.control[listKeys[index]] = [oldValue[0],maxValue]
 793
 794        return self.control
 795
 796    def setValues(self, controlPointsDict):
 797        """
 798        Set all control points from dictionary.
 799        
 800        Args:
 801            controlPointsDict (dict): Dictionary of control point coordinates
 802        """
 803        self.control = copy.deepcopy(controlPointsDict)

 807class LightnessMaskModel():
 808    """
 809    Model for lightness-based masking to enable selective tone range editing.
 810    
 811    Manages boolean masks for different luminance ranges allowing selective
 812    application of adjustments to specific tonal areas of the image.
 813    
 814    Tone ranges:
 815    - shadows: Darkest areas
 816    - blacks: Dark areas 
 817    - mediums: Mid-tones
 818    - whites: Bright areas
 819    - highlights: Brightest areas
 820    
 821    Attributes:
 822        - controller: Reference to parent controller
 823        - masks (dict): Boolean mask state for each tone range
 824    """
 825    def __init__(self, _controller):
 826        """
 827        Initialize lightness mask model.
 828        
 829        Args:
 830            _controller: Parent LightnessMaskController instance
 831        """
 832        self.controller = _controller
 833
 834        self.masks = {'shadows': False, 'blacks':False, 'mediums':False, 'whites':False, 'highlights':False}
 835
 836    def maskChange(self, key, on_off):
 837        """
 838        Toggle mask state for a specific tone range.
 839        
 840        Args:
 841            key (str): Tone range name ('shadows', 'blacks', etc.)
 842            on_off (bool): New mask state
 843            
 844        Returns:
 845            dict: Updated mask dictionary
 846        """
 847        if key in self.masks.keys(): self.masks[key] = on_off
 848        return copy.deepcopy(self.masks)
 849
 850    def setValues(self, values): 
 851        """
 852        Set all mask values from dictionary.
 853        
 854        Args:
 855            values (dict): New mask configuration
 856        """
 857        self.masks = copy.deepcopy(values)

 861class ImageInfoModel(object):
 862    """
 863    Model for image information and metadata management.
 864    
 865    Handles display and editing of image metadata including EXIF data
 866    and user-defined tags. Supports modification of custom metadata
 867    fields for workflow management.
 868    
 869    Attributes:
 870        - controller: Reference to parent controller
 871        - processPipe (ProcessPipe): Current image processing pipeline
 872    """
 873
 874    def __init__(self,controller):
 875        """
 876        Initialize image info model.
 877        
 878        Args:
 879            controller: Parent ImageInfoController instance
 880        """
 881        self.controller = controller
 882
 883        # ref to ImageGalleryModel.processPipes[ImageGalleryModel._selectedImage]
 884        self.processPipe = None 
 885
 886    def getProcessPipe(self): 
 887        """
 888        Get current processing pipeline.
 889        
 890        Returns:
 891            ProcessPipe or None: Current processing pipeline
 892        """
 893        return self.processPipe
 894
 895    def setProcessPipe(self, processPipe):  
 896        """
 897        Set new processing pipeline.
 898        
 899        Args:
 900            processPipe (ProcessPipe): New processing pipeline
 901        """
 902        self.processPipe = processPipe
 903
 904    def changeMeta(self,tagGroup,tag, on_off): 
 905        """
 906        Update metadata field value.
 907        
 908        Modifies user-defined metadata tags within the processing pipeline
 909        and updates the metadata structure accordingly.
 910        
 911        Args:
 912            tagGroup (str): Metadata group name
 913            tag (str): Specific tag name within group
 914            on_off (bool): New tag value
 915        """
 916        if pref.verbose:  print(" [MODEL] >> ImageInfoModel.changeMeta(",tagGroup,",",tag,",", on_off,")")
 917
 918        if isinstance(self.processPipe, hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe):
 919            tagRootName = self.processPipe.getImage().metadata.otherTags.getTagsRootName()
 920            tags = copy.deepcopy(self.processPipe.getImage().metadata.metadata[tagRootName])
 921            found, updatedMeta = False, []
 922            for tt in tags:
 923                if tagGroup in tt.keys():
 924                    if tag in tt[tagGroup].keys():
 925                        found = True
 926                        tt[tagGroup][tag] = on_off 
 927                updatedMeta.append(copy.deepcopy(tt))
 928            self.processPipe.updateUserMeta(tagRootName,updatedMeta)
 929            if pref.verbose: 
 930                print(" [MODEL] >> ImageInfoModel.changeUseCase(",")")
 931                for tt in updatedMeta: print(tt)

 997class LchColorSelectorModel(object):
 998    """
 999    Model for LCH color space selection and editing.
1000    
1001    Manages color selection in LCH (Lightness, Chroma, Hue) color space
1002    with independent range selection for each component and editing
1003    parameters for targeted color adjustments.
1004    
1005    LCH Color Space Components:
1006    - Lightness: 0-100 (brightness)
1007    - Chroma: 0-100 (saturation/colorfulness)  
1008    - Hue: 0-360 (color angle)
1009    
1010    Attributes:
1011        - controller: Reference to parent controller
1012        - lightnessSelection (tuple): (min, max) lightness range
1013        - chromaSelection (tuple): (min, max) chroma range
1014        - hueSelection (tuple): (min, max) hue range
1015        - exposure (float): Exposure adjustment for selected colors
1016        - hueShift (float): Hue shift for selected colors
1017        - contrast (float): Contrast adjustment for selected colors
1018        - saturation (float): Saturation adjustment for selected colors
1019        - mask (bool): Display selection mask
1020        - default (dict): Default values for reset
1021    """
1022    def __init__(self, _controller):
1023        """
1024        Initialize LCH color selector model.
1025        
1026        Args:
1027            _controller: Parent LchColorSelectorController instance
1028        """
1029        self.controller = _controller
1030
1031        self.lightnessSelection =   (0,100)     # min, max
1032        self.chromaSelection =      (0,100)     # min, max
1033        self.hueSelection =         (0,360)     # min, max
1034
1035        self.exposure =     0.0
1036        self.hueShift =     0.0
1037        self.contrast =     0.0
1038        self.saturation =   0.0
1039
1040        self.mask =         False
1041
1042        # -------------
1043        self.default = {
1044            "selection": {"lightness": [ 0, 100 ],"chroma": [ 0, 100 ],"hue": [ 0, 360 ]},
1045            "edit": {"hue": 0,"exposure": 0,"contrast": 0,"saturation": 0},
1046            "mask": False}
1047        # -------------

1059            dict: Updated complete configuration
1060        """

1077

1079        """

1081

1084            lMax (float): Maximum lightness value (0-100)
1085            
1086        Returns:

1091

1111

1114        """

1116        return self.getValues()
1117

1119        """
1120        Set contrast adjustment for selected colors.
1121

1124

1127        """

1129        return self.getValues()
1130

1134

1137            
1138        Returns:
1139            dict: Updated complete configuration
1140        """

1150

1153        """

1155        return self.getValues()
1156
1157    def getValues(self):
1158        """
1159        Get complete LCH color selector configuration.
1160        
1161        Returns:
1162            dict: Complete configuration with selection ranges and edit parameters
1163        """
1164        return {
1165            'selection':    {'lightness': self.lightnessSelection ,'chroma': self.chromaSelection,'hue':self.hueSelection}, 
1166            'edit':         {'hue':self.hueShift,'exposure':self.exposure,'contrast':self.contrast,'saturation':self.saturation}, 
1167            'mask':         self.mask
1168            }
1169
1170    def setValues(self, values):
1171        """
1172        Set configuration from dictionary with safe defaults.
1173        
1174        Args:
1175            values (dict): Configuration dictionary with selection and edit parameters
1176        """
1177        self.lightnessSelection =   values['selection']['lightness']    if 'lightness' in values['selection'].keys() else (0,100)
1178        self.chromaSelection =      values['selection']['chroma']       if 'chroma' in values['selection'].keys() else (0,100)
1179        self.hueSelection =         values['selection']['hue']          if 'hue' in values['selection'].keys() else (0,360)
1180
1181        self.exposure =     values['edit']['exposure']      if 'exposure' in values['edit'].keys() else 0
1182        self.hueShift =     values['edit']['hue']           if 'hue' in values['edit'].keys() else 0
1183        self.contrast =     values['edit']['contrast']      if 'contrast' in values['edit'].keys() else 0
1184        self.saturation =   values['edit']['saturation']    if 'saturation' in values['edit'].keys() else 0
1185
1186        self.mask =         values['mask']  if 'mask' in values.keys() else False

1190class GeometryModel(object):
1191    """
1192    Model for geometric transformations including rotation and cropping.

1195    including aspect ratio cropping and rotation adjustments.

1209        """

1258        self.ratio =    values['ratio']     if 'ratio'      in values.keys() else (16,9)
1259        self.up =       values['up']        if 'up'         in values.keys() else 0.0
1260        self.rotation = values['rotation']  if 'rotation'   in values.keys() else 0.0

1264class ImageAestheticsModel:
1265    """
1266    Model for image aesthetics analysis and color palette extraction.
1267    
1268    Manages aesthetic analysis of HDR images including color palette generation,
1269    composition analysis, and visual quality assessment. Uses K-means clustering
1270    for dominant color extraction and provides visual representations.
1271    
1272    Attributes:
1273        - parent (ImageAestheticsController): Parent controller reference
1274        - requireUpdate (bool): Flag indicating analysis needs refresh
1275        - processPipe (ProcessPipe): Current image processing pipeline
1276        - colorPalette (Palette): Extracted color palette from image
1277    """
1278    def __init__(self, parent):
1279        """
1280        Initialize image aesthetics model.
1281        
1282        Args:
1283            parent (ImageAestheticsController): Parent controller instance
1284        """
1285        if pref.verbose: print(" [MODEL] >> ImageAestheticsModel.__init__(",")")
1286        
1287        self.parent = parent
1288
1289        # processPipeHasChanged
1290        self.requireUpdate = True
1291
1292
1293        # ref to ImageGalleryModel.processPipes[ImageGalleryModel._selectedImage]
1294        self.processPipe = None 
1295
1296        # color palette
1297        self.colorPalette = hdrCore.aesthetics.Palette('defaultLab5',
1298                                                       np.linspace([0,0,0],[100,0,0],5),
1299                                                       hdrCore.image.ColorSpace.build('Lab'), 
1300                                                       hdrCore.image.imageType.SDR)
1301    # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1302    def getProcessPipe(self): 
1303        """
1304        Get current processing pipeline.
1305        
1306        Returns:
1307            ProcessPipe or None: Current processing pipeline
1308        """
1309        return self.processPipe
1310    # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1311    def setProcessPipe(self, processPipe):  
1312        """
1313        Set new processing pipeline and trigger aesthetics analysis.
1314        
1315        If the pipeline has changed, triggers color palette extraction
1316        and aesthetic analysis using K-means clustering on the image data.
1317        
1318        Args:
1319            processPipe (ProcessPipe): New processing pipeline to analyze
1320        """
1321        if pref.verbose: print(" [MODEL] >> ImageAestheticsModel.setProcessPipe(",")")
1322
1323        if processPipe != self.processPipe:
1324        
1325            self.processPipe = processPipe
1326            self.requireUpdate = True
1327
1328        if self.requireUpdate:
1329
1330            self.colorPalette = hdrCore.aesthetics.Palette.build(self.processPipe)
1331            # COMPUTE IMAGE OF PALETTE
1332            paletteIMG = self.colorPalette.createImageOfPalette()
1333
1334            self.endComputing()
1335
1336        else: pass
1337    # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1338    def endComputing(self):
1339        """
1340        Mark aesthetics analysis as complete.
1341        
1342        Resets the requireUpdate flag to indicate that analysis is current.
1343        """
1344        self.requireUpdate = False
1345    # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1346    def getPaletteImage(self):
1347        """
1348        Get visual representation of the extracted color palette.
1349        
1350        Returns:
1351            numpy.ndarray: RGB image showing the color palette as colored bars
1352        """
1353        return self.colorPalette.createImageOfPalette()

1358class ColorEditorsAutoModel:
1359    """
1360    Model for automatic color editor configuration using K-means clustering.
1361    
1362    Automatically analyzes an image to extract dominant colors and configures
1363    multiple color editors with appropriate LCH selection ranges for targeted
1364    color correction. Uses K-means clustering in Lab color space.
1365    
1366    Attributes:
1367        - controller: Reference to parent controller
1368        - processStepId (str): Name of processing step to analyze
1369        - nbColors (int): Number of dominant colors to extract
1370        - removeBlack (bool): Whether to exclude dark/black regions from analysis
1371    """
1372    def __init__(self,_controller, processStepName,nbColors, removeBlack= True):
1373        """
1374        Initialize automatic color editors model.
1375        
1376        Args:
1377            _controller: Parent ColorEditorsAutoController instance
1378            processStepName (str): Name of processing step to analyze
1379            nbColors (int): Number of dominant colors to extract (2-8)
1380            removeBlack (bool): Exclude dark regions from analysis
1381        """
1382        self.controller = _controller
1383        self.processStepId = processStepName
1384        self.nbColors = nbColors
1385        self.removeBlack = removeBlack
1386
1387    def compute(self):
1388        """
1389        Compute automatic color editor configurations using K-means clustering.
1390        
1391        Analyzes the image at the specified processing step using K-means clustering
1392        in Lab color space to identify dominant colors. Generates LCH selection
1393        ranges for each color editor with appropriate hue, chroma, and lightness
1394        boundaries.
1395        
1396        Algorithm:
1397        1. Extract image data from specified processing step
1398        2. Convert to Lab color space if needed
1399        3. Apply K-means clustering with (nbColors + 1) clusters
1400        4. Remove darkest cluster if removeBlack is enabled
1401        5. Convert cluster centers to LCH space
1402        6. Sort by hue angle
1403        7. Generate selection ranges with ±25 tolerance for each cluster
1404        
1405        Returns:
1406            list[dict]: List of color editor configurations with selection and edit parameters
1407        """
1408        # get image according to processId
1409        processPipe = self.controller.parent.controller.getProcessPipe()
1410        if processPipe != None:
1411            image_ = processPipe.processNodes[processPipe.getProcessNodeByName(self.processStepId)].outputImage
1412
1413            if image_.colorSpace.name == 'Lch':
1414                LchPixels = image_.colorData
1415            elif image_.colorSpace.name == 'sRGB':
1416                if image_.linear: 
1417                    colorLab = hdrCore.processing.sRGB_to_Lab(image_.colorData, apply_cctf_decoding=False)
1418                    LchPixels = colour.Lab_to_LCHab(colorLab)
1419                else:
1420                    colorLab = hdrCore.processing.sRGB_to_Lab(image_.colorData, apply_cctf_decoding=True)
1421                    LchPixels = colour.Lab_to_LCHab(colorLab)
1422
1423            # to Lab then to Vector
1424            LabPixels = colour.LCHab_to_Lab(LchPixels)
1425            LabPixelsVector = hdrCore.utils.ndarray2vector(LabPixels)
1426
1427            # k-means: nb cluster = nbColors + 1
1428            kmeans_cluster_Lab = sklearn.cluster.KMeans(n_clusters=self.nbColors+1)
1429            kmeans_cluster_Lab.fit(LabPixelsVector)
1430            cluster_centers_Lab = kmeans_cluster_Lab.cluster_centers_
1431            cluster_labels_Lab = kmeans_cluster_Lab.labels_
1432                
1433            # remove darkness one
1434            idxLmin = np.argmin(cluster_centers_Lab[:,0])                           # idx of darkness
1435            cluster_centers_Lab = np.delete(cluster_centers_Lab, idxLmin, axis=0)   # remove min from cluster_centers_Lab
1436
1437            # go to Lch
1438            cluster_centers_Lch = colour.Lab_to_LCHab(cluster_centers_Lab) 
1439
1440            # sort cluster by hue
1441            cluster_centersIdx = np.argsort(cluster_centers_Lch[:,2])
1442
1443            dictValuesList = []
1444            for j in range(len(cluster_centersIdx)):
1445                i = cluster_centersIdx[j]
1446                if j==0: Hmin = 0
1447                else: Hmin = 0.5*(cluster_centers_Lch[cluster_centersIdx[j-1]][2] + cluster_centers_Lch[cluster_centersIdx[j]][2])
1448                if j == len(cluster_centersIdx)-1: Hmax = 360
1449                else: Hmax = 0.5*(cluster_centers_Lch[cluster_centersIdx[j]][2] + cluster_centers_Lch[cluster_centersIdx[j+1]][2])
1450
1451                Cmin = max(0, cluster_centers_Lch[cluster_centersIdx[j]][1]-25) 
1452                Cmax = min(100, cluster_centers_Lch[cluster_centersIdx[j]][1]+25) 
1453
1454                Lmin = max(0, cluster_centers_Lch[cluster_centersIdx[j]][0]-25) 
1455                Lmax = min(100, cluster_centers_Lch[cluster_centersIdx[j]][0]+25) 
1456
1457                dictSegment =  {
1458                    "selection": {
1459                        "lightness":    [ int(Lmin),  int(Lmax)],
1460                        "chroma":       [ int(Cmin),  int(Cmax)],
1461                        "hue":          [ int(Hmin),  int(Hmax)]},
1462                    "edit": {"hue": 0,"exposure": 0,"contrast": 0,"saturation": 0},
1463                    "mask": False}
1464                dictValuesList.append(dictSegment)
1465
1466            return dictValuesList

class ImageGalleryModel: 
120class ImageGalleryModel:
121    """
122    Model for image gallery management with pagination and process-pipes.
123    
124    Handles a collection of images with their associated processing pipelines,
125    supporting paginated display and thumbnail generation. Each image has an
126    associated ProcessPipe for HDR editing operations.
127    
128    Attributes:
129        - controller (ImageGalleryController): Parent controller reference
130        - imageFilenames (list[str]): List of image file paths
131        - processPipes (list[ProcessPipe]): HDR processing pipelines for each image
132        - _selectedImage (int): Index of currently selected image (-1 if none)
133        - aestheticsModels (list): Aesthetic analysis models for images
134    """
135
136    def __init__(self, _controller):
137        """
138        Initialize the image gallery model.
139        
140        Args:
141            _controller (ImageGalleryController): Parent controller instance
142        """
143        if pref.verbose:  print(" [MODEL] >> ImageGalleryModel.__init__()")
144
145        self.controller = _controller
146        self.imageFilenames = []
147        self.processPipes = []
148        self._selectedImage= -1
149
150        self.aesthetics = []
151
152    def setSelectedImage(self,id): 
153        """
154        Set the currently selected image by index.
155        
156        Args:
157            id (int): Index of image to select
158        """
159        self._selectedImage = id
160
161    def selectedImage(self): 
162        """
163        Get the index of currently selected image.
164        
165        Returns:
166            int: Selected image index (-1 if none selected)
167        """
168        return self._selectedImage
169
170    def getSelectedProcessPipe(self):
171        """
172        Get the ProcessPipe associated with the selected image.
173        
174        Returns:
175            ProcessPipe or None: Processing pipeline for selected image
176        """
177        if pref.verbose: print(" [MODEL] >> ImageGalleryModel.getSelectedProcessPipe(",  ")")
178
179        res = None
180        if self._selectedImage != -1: res= self.processPipes[self._selectedImage]
181        return res
182
183    def setImages(self, filenames):
184        """
185        Load a new set of images into the gallery.
186        
187        Initializes the gallery with new image filenames, resets all process-pipes
188        and aesthetics models, then loads the first page.
189        
190        Args:
191            filenames (list[str]): List of image file paths to load
192        """
193        if pref.verbose: print(" [MODEL] >> ImageGalleryModel.setImages(",len(list(copy.deepcopy(filenames))), "images)")
194
195        self.imageFilenames = list(filenames)
196        self.imagesMetadata, self.processPipes =  [], [] # reset metadata and processPipes
197
198        self.aestheticsModels = [] # reset aesthetics models
199
200        nbImagePage = controller.GalleryMode.nbRow(self.controller.view.shapeMode)*controller.GalleryMode.nbCol(self.controller.view.shapeMode)
201        for f in self.imageFilenames: # load only first page
202            self.processPipes.append(None)
203        self.controller.updateImages() # update controller to update view
204        self.loadPage(0)
205
206    def loadPage(self,nb):
207        """
208        Load and process images for a specific page.
209        
210        Loads images for the specified page number, creating ProcessPipes
211        for new images and updating existing ones. Uses threading for
212        efficient parallel loading.
213        
214        Args:
215            nb (int): Page number to load (0-indexed)
216        """
217        if pref.verbose:  print(" [MODEL] >> ImageGalleryModel.loadPage(",nb,")")
218        nbImagePage = controller.GalleryMode.nbRow(self.controller.view.shapeMode)*controller.GalleryMode.nbCol(self.controller.view.shapeMode)
219        min_,max_ = (nb*nbImagePage), ((nb+1)*nbImagePage)
220
221        loadThreads = thread.RequestLoadImage(self)
222
223        for i,f in enumerate(self.imageFilenames[min_:max_]): # load only the current page nb
224            if not isinstance(self.processPipes[min_+i],hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe):
225                self.controller.parent.statusBar().showMessage("read image: "+f)
226                self.controller.parent.statusBar().repaint()
227                loadThreads.requestLoad(min_,i, f)
228            else:
229                self.controller.view.updateImage(i, self.processPipes[min_+i], f)
230
231    def save(self):
232        """
233        Save all ProcessPipe configurations to their associated image metadata.
234        
235        Iterates through all ProcessPipes and saves their parameters as metadata
236        in the corresponding image files for persistence.
237        """
238        if pref.verbose:  print(" [MODEL] >> ImageGalleryModel.save()")
239
240        for i,p in enumerate(self.processPipes):
241            if isinstance(p, hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe): 
242                p.getImage().metadata.metadata['processpipe'] = p.toDict()            
243                p.getImage().metadata.save()
244
245    def getFilenamesOfCurrentPage(self):
246        """
247        Get the filenames for images on the current page.
248        
249        Returns:
250            list[str]: Filenames of images currently displayed
251        """
252        minIdx, maxIdx = self.controller.pageIdx()
253        return copy.deepcopy(self.imageFilenames[minIdx:maxIdx])
254
255    def getProcessPipeById(self,i):
256        """
257        Get ProcessPipe by index.
258        
259        Args:
260            i (int): Index of desired ProcessPipe
261            
262        Returns:
263            ProcessPipe: Processing pipeline at specified index
264        """
265        return self.processPipes[i]

class AppModel: 
270class AppModel(object):
271    """
272    Main application model managing global state.
273    
274    Handles the top-level application state including current working directory,
275    image file lists, and HDR display configuration.
276    
277    Attributes:
278        - controller: Reference to parent AppController
279        - directory (str): Current working directory path
280        - imageFilenames (list[str]): List of image files in directory
281        - displayHDRProcess: HDR display process reference
282        - displayModel (dict): HDR display configuration with scaling and shape
283    """
284
285    def __init__(self, controller):
286        """
287        Initialize the application model.
288        
289        Args:
290            controller: Parent AppController instance
291        """
292        # attributes
293        self.controller = controller
294        self.directory = pref.getImagePath()
295        self.imageFilenames = []
296        self.displayHDRProcess = None
297        #V5
298        self.displayModel = {'scaling':12, 'shape':(2160,3840)}
299
300    def setDirectory(self,path):
301        """
302        Set working directory and scan for supported image files.
303        
304        Args:
305            path (str): Directory path to scan
306            
307        Returns:
308            iterator: Image filenames found in directory
309        """
310        # read directory and return image filename list
311        self.directory =path
312        pref.setImagePath(path)
313        self.imageFilenames = map(lambda x: os.path.join(self.directory,x),
314                                  hdrCore.utils.filterlistdir(self.directory,('.jpg','.JPG','.hdr','.HDR')))
315
316        return self.imageFilenames

285    def __init__(self, controller):
286        """
287        Initialize the application model.

def setDirectory(self, path): 
300    def setDirectory(self,path):
301        """
302        Set working directory and scan for supported image files.
303        
304        Args:
305            path (str): Directory path to scan
306            
307        Returns:
308            iterator: Image filenames found in directory
309        """
310        # read directory and return image filename list
311        self.directory =path
312        pref.setImagePath(path)
313        self.imageFilenames = map(lambda x: os.path.join(self.directory,x),
314                                  hdrCore.utils.filterlistdir(self.directory,('.jpg','.JPG','.hdr','.HDR')))
315
316        return self.imageFilenames

class EditImageModel: 
320class EditImageModel(object):
321    """
322    Model for comprehensive HDR image editing pipeline.
323    
324    Manages the complete HDR image editing workflow including exposure adjustment,
325    contrast control, tone curve manipulation, color editing, and geometric 
326    transformations. Coordinates with threading system for real-time preview.
327    
328    The model builds and manages a ProcessPipe containing:
329    - Exposure adjustment
330    - Contrast control
331    - B-spline tone curve editing
332    - Lightness masking for selective editing
333    - Saturation adjustment
334    - Five independent color editors for targeted color correction
335    - Geometric transformations (rotation, cropping)
336    
337    Attributes:
338        - controller: Reference to EditImageController
339        - autoPreviewHDR (bool): Enable automatic HDR preview updates
340        - processpipe (ProcessPipe): Current HDR processing pipeline
341        - requestCompute (RequestCompute): Threading coordinator for real-time updates
342    """
343    def __init__(self,controller):
344        """
345        Initialize the HDR image editing model.
346        
347        Args:
348            controller: Parent EditImageController instance
349        """
350        self.controller = controller
351
352        self.autoPreviewHDR = False
353
354        # ref to ImageGalleryModel.processPipes[ImageGalleryModel._selectedImage]
355        self.processpipe = None 
356
357        # create a RequestCompute
358        self.requestCompute  = thread.RequestCompute(self)
359
360    def getProcessPipe(self): 
361        """
362        Get the current processing pipeline.
363        
364        Returns:
365            ProcessPipe: Current HDR processing pipeline
366        """
367        return self.processpipe
368
369    def setProcessPipe(self, processPipe): 
370        """
371        Set a new processing pipeline and trigger computation.
372        
373        Args:
374            processPipe (ProcessPipe): New processing pipeline to use
375            
376        Returns:
377            bool: True if pipeline was set successfully, False if system busy
378        """
379        if self.requestCompute.readyToRun:
380            self.processpipe = processPipe
381            self.requestCompute.setProcessPipe(self.processpipe)
382            self.processpipe.compute()
383            if self.controller.previewHDR and self.autoPreviewHDR:
384                img = self.processpipe.getImage(toneMap = False)
385                self.controller.controllerHDR.displayIMG(img)
386            return True
387        else:
388            return False
389
390    @staticmethod
391    def buildProcessPipe():
392        """
393        Create a default HDR processing pipeline.
394        
395        Builds a complete ProcessPipe with all editing stages configured
396        with default parameters. The pipeline includes exposure, contrast,
397        tone curve, masking, saturation, color editors, and geometry.
398        
399        WARNING: The initial pipe does not have an input image and must be
400        configured with setImage() before use.
401        
402        Returns:
403            ProcessPipe: Configured processing pipeline with default parameters
404        """
405        processPipe = hdrCore.processing.ProcessPipe()
406
407        # exposure ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
408        defaultParameterEV = {'EV': 0}                                              
409        idExposureProcessNode = processPipe.append(hdrCore.processing.exposure(), paramDict=None,name="exposure")   
410        processPipe.setParameters(idExposureProcessNode, defaultParameterEV)                                        
411
412        # contrast ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
413        defaultParameterContrast = {'contrast': 0}                                  
414        idContrastProcessNode = processPipe.append(hdrCore.processing.contrast(), paramDict=None,  name="contrast") 
415        processPipe.setParameters(idContrastProcessNode, defaultParameterContrast)                                  
416
417        #tonecurve ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
418        defaultParameterYcurve = {'start':[0,0], 
419                                  'shadows': [10,10],
420                                  'blacks': [30,30], 
421                                  'mediums': [50,50], 
422                                  'whites': [70,70], 
423                                  'highlights': [90,90], 
424                                  'end': [100,100]}                         
425        idYcurveProcessNode = processPipe.append(hdrCore.processing.Ycurve(), paramDict=None,name="tonecurve")      
426        processPipe.setParameters(idYcurveProcessNode, defaultParameterYcurve)   
427        
428        # masklightness ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
429        defaultMask = { 'shadows': False, 
430                       'blacks': False, 
431                       'mediums': False, 
432                       'whites': False, 
433                       'highlights': False}
434        idLightnessMaskProcessNode = processPipe.append(hdrCore.processing.lightnessMask(), paramDict=None, name="lightnessmask")  
435        processPipe.setParameters(idLightnessMaskProcessNode, defaultMask)  
436
437        # saturation ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
438        defaultValue = {'saturation': 0.0,  'method': 'gamma'}
439        idSaturationProcessNode = processPipe.append(hdrCore.processing.saturation(), paramDict=None, name="saturation")    
440        processPipe.setParameters(idSaturationProcessNode, defaultValue)                     
441
442        # colorEditor0 ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
443        defaultParameterColorEditor0= {'selection': {'lightness': (0,100),'chroma': (0,100),'hue':(0,360)},  
444                                       'edit': {'hue': 0.0, 'exposure':0.0, 'contrast':0.0,'saturation':0.0}, 
445                                       'mask': False}        
446        idColorEditor0ProcessNode = processPipe.append(hdrCore.processing.colorEditor(), paramDict=None, name="colorEditor0")  
447        processPipe.setParameters(idColorEditor0ProcessNode, defaultParameterColorEditor0)
448
449        # colorEditor1 ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
450        defaultParameterColorEditor1= {'selection': {'lightness': (0,100),'chroma': (0,100),'hue':(0,360)},  
451                                       'edit': {'hue': 0.0, 'exposure':0.0, 'contrast':0.0,'saturation':0.0}, 
452                                       'mask': False}        
453        idColorEditor1ProcessNode = processPipe.append(hdrCore.processing.colorEditor(), paramDict=None, name="colorEditor1")  
454        processPipe.setParameters(idColorEditor1ProcessNode, defaultParameterColorEditor1)
455        
456        # colorEditor2 ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
457        defaultParameterColorEditor2= {'selection': {'lightness': (0,100),'chroma': (0,100),'hue':(0,360)},  
458                                       'edit': {'hue': 0.0, 'exposure':0.0, 'contrast':0.0,'saturation':0.0}, 
459                                       'mask': False}        
460        idColorEditor2ProcessNode = processPipe.append(hdrCore.processing.colorEditor(), paramDict=None, name="colorEditor2")  
461        processPipe.setParameters(idColorEditor2ProcessNode, defaultParameterColorEditor2)
462        
463        # colorEditor3 ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
464        defaultParameterColorEditor3= {'selection': {'lightness': (0,100),'chroma': (0,100),'hue':(0,360)},  
465                                       'edit': {'hue': 0.0, 'exposure':0.0, 'contrast':0.0,'saturation':0.0}, 
466                                       'mask': False}        
467        idColorEditor3ProcessNode = processPipe.append(hdrCore.processing.colorEditor(), paramDict=None, name="colorEditor3")  
468        processPipe.setParameters(idColorEditor3ProcessNode, defaultParameterColorEditor3)
469        
470        # colorEditor4 ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
471        defaultParameterColorEditor4= {'selection': {'lightness': (0,100),'chroma': (0,100),'hue':(0,360)},  
472                                       'edit': {'hue': 0.0, 'exposure':0.0, 'contrast':0.0,'saturation':0.0}, 
473                                       'mask': False}        
474        idColorEditor4ProcessNode = processPipe.append(hdrCore.processing.colorEditor(), paramDict=None, name="colorEditor4")  
475        processPipe.setParameters(idColorEditor4ProcessNode, defaultParameterColorEditor4)
476
477        # geometry ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
478        defaultValue = { 'ratio': (16,9), 'up': 0,'rotation': 0.0}
479        idGeometryNode = processPipe.append(hdrCore.processing.geometry(), paramDict=None, name="geometry")    
480        processPipe.setParameters(idGeometryNode, defaultValue)
481        # ------------ --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
482
483        return processPipe
484
485    def autoExposure(self):
486        """
487        Automatically calculate and apply optimal exposure settings.
488        
489        Uses the exposure process's automatic calculation method to determine
490        optimal exposure value based on image content and applies it to the pipeline.
491        
492        Returns:
493            numpy.ndarray: Processed image with auto-exposure applied
494        """
495        if pref.verbose:  print(" [MODEL] >> EditImageModel.autoExposure(",")")
496
497        id = self.processpipe.getProcessNodeByName("exposure")
498        exposureProcess = self.processpipe.processNodes[id].process
499        img= self.processpipe.getInputImage()
500        EV = exposureProcess.auto(img)
501        self.processpipe.setParameters(id,EV)
502
503        self.processpipe.compute()
504
505        if self.controller.previewHDR and self.autoPreviewHDR:
506            img = self.processpipe.getImage(toneMap = False)
507            self.controller.controllerHDR.displayIMG(img)
508
509        return self.processpipe.getImage()
510
511    def changeExposure(self,value):
512        """
513        Manually adjust exposure value.
514        
515        Args:
516            value (float): Exposure adjustment in EV stops
517        """
518        if pref.verbose:  print(" [MODEL] >> EditImageModel.changeExposure(",value,")")
519
520        id = self.processpipe.getProcessNodeByName("exposure")
521        self.requestCompute.requestCompute(id,{'EV': value})
522
523    def getEV(self):
524        """
525        Get current exposure value settings.
526        
527        Returns:
528            dict: Current exposure parameters
529        """
530        if pref.verbose:  print(" [MODEL] >> EditImageModel.getEV(",")")
531        id = self.processpipe.getProcessNodeByName("exposure")
532        return self.processpipe.getParameters(id)
533
534    def changeContrast(self,value):
535        """
536        Adjust contrast parameters.
537        
538        Args:
539            value (float): Contrast adjustment value
540        """
541        if pref.verbose:  print(" [MODEL] >> EditImageModel.changeContrast(",value,")")
542
543        id = self.processpipe.getProcessNodeByName("contrast")
544        self.requestCompute.requestCompute(id,{'contrast': value})
545

566
567        id = self.processpipe.getProcessNodeByName("lightnessmask")
568        self.requestCompute.requestCompute(id,maskValues)

578
579        id = self.processpipe.getProcessNodeByName("saturation")

591
592        id = self.processpipe.getProcessNodeByName(idName)
593        self.requestCompute.requestCompute(id,values)

603
604        id = self.processpipe.getProcessNodeByName("geometry")
605        self.requestCompute.requestCompute(id,values)

614        self.controller.updateImage(imgTM)

Model for comprehensive HDR image editing pipeline.

Manages the complete HDR image editing workflow including exposure adjustment, contrast control, tone curve manipulation, color editing, and geometric transformations. Coordinates with threading system for real-time preview.

The model builds and manages a ProcessPipe containing:

  • Exposure adjustment
  • Contrast control
  • B-spline tone curve editing
  • Lightness masking for selective editing
  • Saturation adjustment
  • Five independent color editors for targeted color correction
  • Geometric transformations (rotation, cropping)

Attributes: - controller: Reference to EditImageController - autoPreviewHDR (bool): Enable automatic HDR preview updates - processpipe (ProcessPipe): Current HDR processing pipeline - requestCompute (RequestCompute): Threading coordinator for real-time updates
